page.title: 03Brick making in Fletton - 2
page.content: The suitable small pieces of clay from the separator were then pressed together into a brick shape and these, because of their colour were called green bricks. After the green bricks were burnt they were called commons. If they are to be more important facing bricks then they are blasted with coloured dry clay. Then we saw the workmen stacking the bricks by hand into a special pattern. They do have machines which try to do this but they keep breaking down. After they are stacked, a fork lift truck comes along and takes the stack to one of the many chambers which make up the kiln.
